lines.speaker: Grizzlebeard
lines.text: I used to be an adventurer like you, until I took an arrow to the knee.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: Oh, the classic line. And now what? Besides romanticizing old injuries?

lines.speaker: Grizzlebeard
lines.text: I sit by this bonfire, offer advice no one asked for, and guard my soup from the undead.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: Soup? Is that a euphemism for souls, or are you actually cooking here?

lines.speaker: Grizzlebeard
lines.text: Soup is sacred, lass! It’s a wild boar stew with potatoes, been simmering for three moon cycles.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: Wow. Three cycles... so it’s either charcoal by now or blessed by some dark god.

lines.speaker: Grizzlebeard
lines.text: Blasphemy! It’s an ancient tradition. Plus, it has healing properties. Almost made me forget the arrow.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: (Is everyone in this world traumatized or is it just part of the tutorial?)

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: Nothing, nothing. Just wondering if that soup heals existential dread or just gives me dysentery.
